p: Nitazoxanide, a thiazolide class of drugs, is an antiprotozoal agent used for the treatment of various protozoal and helminthic infections [134]. Apart from its antiprotozoal potential, nitazoxanide has established itself as a broad-spectrum antiviral agent showing potency against both the DNA and RNA viruses [135]. Recently, nitazoxanide was shown to effectively inhibit the SARS-CoV-2 in Vero E6 cells (EC 50 = 2.12 µM) [62]. Considering its antiviral property along with its anti-inflammatory potential [136], nitazoxanide could act as a possible therapeutic intervention for COVID-19. However, further studies must be conducted to warrant such a claim.
